comment: She was a huge help and very great at communication. Her class is very easy just make sure you do the work and you will do well in this class.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: i took her hybrid ethnic minority class. professor bagasra's class was always a class i looked forward to. i learned a lot. from the beginning, she establishes an environment where her students are comfortable speaking in. the class mostly consisted of quizzes (on d2l), papers, group project, and class discussions. take her if you can!!

Dr. B is very caring and very accommodating, I was not a fan of her Wikipedia project and her quizzes can be a little weirdly worded but other than that she is not a tough grader and wants you to learn and pass! She had no tests or exams, just some essay assignments, quizzes, the project.

We had a Wikipedia project. All you have to do is choose an article and edit a section you can do more! We have a lot of one-page reaction essays, the first quiz is a little hard! Quizzes are open notes discussion posts, no extra credit. Very understanding and communicative professor! Class is very accessible put in the work and you will get an A!
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--So many papers

comment: Professor Bagasra is an amazing professor. She is so kind and will do anything to help you. I loved her lectures, and she will really teach you the information you need. There is a pretty decent work load and the online content is at times unorganized but it was worth it for her/the content. Highly recommend.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback

comment: I liked Dr.B her I took her hybrid class and all the assignments were online. About 4 quizzes, 1 group project, and the rest was 1-2 page writing assignments. We also had discussions! Her group projects were okay! I am taking her again in the spring. She is a solid choice she did not always provide good feedback on why I missed points, but take her

Professor was great lectures was excellent for being used in and outside of the classroom. No test or quizzes were given and grading criteria was very specific. Homework assignments had very clear instructions. Textbook was not required easy to assist if you misunderstood an assignment.
An A is easily obtainable if you do the assignments.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Accessible outside class--Graded by few things

comment: She is honestly one of the better professors I've had at KSU. I took senior capstone during summer and she was great! 2 assignments a week but if you did what she said, you got an A. I wish all professors were like this. As long as you follow the prompts, you are golden!

She's nice and the class is very easy. There are no exams only a few quizzes, and discussion posts/small papers. Her instructions are unclear and bare minimum, but most of the time she isn't a harsh grader. Only the group project was stressful, having to do it online. She didn't provide any clear instructions but decided to grade us harshly on it.

She is great but I think theres some disconnect when we had to switch online. The final group project was so irritating to do because her criteria wasn't clear and it was hard to get in contact with group members. No tests, only some essays, open note quizzes, discussion posts, and the final group project. I would take her again just in person.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Group projects

comment: My favorite class ever. There were no tests. There are papers (super easy), quizzes (open note, but look over materials in the module, a few discussion posts, and 1 group project. the group project isnt bad, but dont procrastinate with it. She is my favorite professor ever, and she wants you to succeed. I actually wanted to go to the lectures

She is a great professor and very knowledgeable but her lectures were switched online because of covid and she clears her throat every 2 minutes which is extremely annoying. Her workload is manageable but her final group project is super annoying to do online with other people. I would take her again but only if she was in person.

This class is super informative. She never answers emails though and our final group project is all over the place cause of covid. You have tons of essay-type assignments that aren't that hard just time-consuming. I am glad we meet online because I think her class would be pretty boring in person cause she reads from the powerpoints. She is decent.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--So many papers

comment: Psyc of religion was a pretty easy class. There were no tests (just quizzes that were open note). There was a lot of reading though for the discussion posts and for the quizzes. There was also a group project that isn't bad if your group members do the work. The final is a research paper that you work on the whole semester, so it was easy.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Great professor! The class was fun, interactive, and easy. You learn a lot about religion and it's a must take if you want to understand people thinking outside your own culture. She's creative and truly humble. If she doesn't know something, she will research it. Great professor and definitely take her class.

Dr. Bagasra is amazing! Her content is clear and interesting, her grading is not harsh, and she makes comments on the lectures that are actually really funny! she doesnt give a lot of assignments overall and the ones she does give are simple enough if you do the reading! Definitely one of the best psychology professors Ive had at KSU.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria--Hilarious

comment: One of the best in the Psychology Department. Her assignments were understandable. Super easy breezy class. Discussion posts (opinion/experience based), a couple small papers (opinions), 4 quizzes (all open note) and one final group project (super small). You will come out of this class enlightened. Take her !!

This class was overall a good choice. It was composed of a lot of discussion posts, 4 quizzes, & 6 papers. Overall, she is a fair grader. All the papers are on political issues or cultural differences based on different readings. Overall, I would deff take this class online if you could!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--So many papers

comment: Lectures are extremely boring. Poster and and a group project. Every week there is typically two assignments and a lot of reading. She does not make the topic interesting AT ALL.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Group projects

comment: Lectures were good, she explained things very well & was engaging. Assignments didnt always have super clear rubrics, but they were straight forward & shes not a harsh grader. Quizzes were open book/ note, there was no final just a final research paper. A nice & easy going professor, just show up to class & pay attention youll do good.

I took Professor Bagasra for death and dying. It was an interesting topic. There really wasn't any point of going to class except for the days that you had to present your projects to the class (children's book and bucket list assignments). There were no tests for this class, only quizzes (open note) and a research proposal.

She is very kind and understanding. You can tell she is passionate about her topic. Her lectures can be a little boring but she does try to engage with her students. If keep her updated on reasons why you can't make it to class she is very understanding. She doesn't do tests but her research paper isn't hard. I am a slacker and id take her again.

Dr. B is one of the best professors at KSU. She is kind, friendly, and understanding. She is someone you will want to take again for other classes. Her knowledge of research and trends in the field is phenomenal. She can make the worst content interesting and she DOES NOT just read her powerpoints. She wants to know her students and values opinions

I really love this professor!! She is passionate about what she teaches about and wants you to enjoying learning the content as well. She is extremely nice, and understands that life happens, and will work with you if assignments are late and such. I plan on taking her again!

A GREAT professor. I took her Death and Dying class. She made a tough subject to talk about very interesting. Easy to talk to. Take her. Kennesaw is lucky to have her!!! This is not about an easy A. This is truly an interesting class.

This was Dr. B's first year here at KSU, and for this course it was pretty easy. It's almost like a research course, everything that we needed to turn in had examples to help you. She was always able to answer your emails, and the assignments weren't hard at all.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures
